questions.question: Are the courses really free?
questions.answer: Yes, the courses are 100% free if you meet the funding criteria—no hidden fees or surprises.

questions.question: What funding options are available?
questions.answer: The kursuok.lt platform offers funding up to €500 for individuals employed under a contract, self-employed, or holding a business license.

questions.question: What are the funding requirements?
questions.answer:
To qualify for funding, you must meet the following criteria:
- Be between 18 and 65 years old
- Be employed under a contract or self-employed
- Have higher education or vocational qualifications
- Be a Lithuanian citizen or a foreigner with a residence permit in Lithuania
- Not have previously used funding from kursuok.lt

questions.question: Can I join if I don’t meet all the funding requirements?
questions.answer: Yes, absolutely! Even if you don’t meet all the criteria, contact us. For motivated students, we provide 100% funding out of our own pocket, even if funding through kursuok.lt isn’t available.

questions.question: In what cases would I need to repay the full course cost?
questions.answer: Only if you don't complete the course (e.g., fail to attend sessions or participate in evaluations) or if you don't fill out the course feedback form within 5 business days of program completion.

questions.question: How are the courses conducted?
questions.answer: Courses are held online via Zoom with an instructor. There are also practical sessions where you'll work on real projects.

questions.question: How long do the courses last?
questions.answer: Courses last approximately 12 weeks, totaling 108 academic hours. Classes are held three times a week for 3 hours each session.

questions.question: What are my commitments when joining the courses?
questions.answer: Engage, put in effort, and actively participate in classes.

questions.question: I’m new to IT. Can I join the courses?
questions.answer: Absolutely! Our courses don’t require specific IT knowledge and are designed for beginners. You only need basic computer skills and English proficiency.

questions.question: How much time should I dedicate to the courses?
questions.answer: The time required depends on the program and your pace. Courses are typically 2–3 times a week, but the overall commitment depends on your rhythm. The best part? You can adapt the schedule to your needs, and we’ll help you stay on track.

questions.question: What are the final assessments like? Are there grades?
questions.answer: In our academy, the final assessment is a project. We don’t grade with marks. Students who successfully complete their project receive a pass and graduate from the course.

questions.question: Will I receive a certificate?
questions.answer: Yes! Upon completing the course, you will receive a Unicamp certificate.

questions.question: What if I can’t attend some classes?
questions.answer: No worries. Most sessions are recorded, so you can watch them later. If you need extra help, our instructors will support you.

questions.question: Can I access the course materials after the course ends?
questions.answer: Yes, you’ll have access to all course materials for 180 days after the course ends. This will allow you to review key topics and strengthen your knowledge. Additionally, you can contact instructors with any questions.
